doc.ContractDescription: NRI SMALL, A NOVEL POWERED LEG PROSTHESIS SIMULATOR FOR SENSING AND CONTROL DEVELOPMENT ROBOTIC LEG PROSTHESES HAVE RECENTLY BEEN DEVELOPED IN AN EFFORT TO RESTORE NATURAL GAIT IN AMPUTEES. FURTHER RESEARCH IS REQUIRED TO ALLOW THESE DEVICES TO PRODUCE ADAPTIVE AND BIOMIMETIC BEHAVIORS ACROSS DIFFERENT WALKING SPEEDS AND TERRAINS. HERE WE PROPOSE TO BUILD A LEG PROSTHESIS SIMULATOR TO EFFECTIVELY SEARCH THE SPACE OF POTENTIAL CONTROL AND SENSING STRATEGIES TO FIND THE BEST MEANS TO IMPROVE AMPUTEE LOCOMOTION THROUGH WEARABLE ELECTROMECHANICAL TECHNOLOGY. USING A CABLE DRIVE MECHANISM, THE PROPOSED LEG PROSTHESIS SIMULATOR WILL USE OFF BOARD POWER, ACTUATION AND CONTROL HARDWARE TO APPLY TORQUE TO BOTH PROSTHETIC AND RESIDUAL LIMB JOINTS WHILE AN AMPUTEE PARTICIPANT WALKS ON AN INSTRUMENTED TREADMILL. THE APPLIED TORQUE PROFILES WILL BE DETERMINED FROM A NEUROMUSCULAR MODEL BASED CONTROL PARADIGM. THE NEUROMUSCULAR MODEL WILL INCLUDE OPTIMIZED MUSCLE TENDON PARAMETERS AS WELL AS A REFLEXIVE FEEDBACK BASED CONTROL SCHEME FOR EACH MUSCLE. FOR A GIVEN AMPUTEE TEST PARTICIPANT, THE MODEL WILL BE TUNED TO MATCH THE PARAMETERS DERIVED FROM A HEIGHT AND WEIGHT MATCHED PERSON WITHOUT AMPUTATION. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH PROGRAM SHALL INCLUDE TWO PHASES. IN A FIRST PHASE, 2.5 YEARS, WE PROPOSE TO DESIGN AND FABRICATE THE TRANSTIBIAL PROSTHESIS SIMULATOR APPARATUS, PROGRAM THE MODEL BASED CONTROL AND SENSING PARADIGMS, AND CLINICALLY EVALUATE THESE PARADIGMS ON WALKING TRANSTIBIAL AMPUTEES THROUGH BIOMECHANICAL AND PHYSIOLOGICAL MEASURES. IN A SECOND PHASE, 2.5 YEARS, WE PROPOSE TO DESIGN AND FABRICATE THE TRANSFEMORAL PROSTHESIS SIMULATOR APPARATUS, PROGRAM THE MODEL BASED CONTROL AND SENSING PARADIGMS, AND EVALUATE THESE PARADIGMS ON WALKING TRANSFEMORAL AMPUTEES THROUGH BIOMECHANICAL AND HYSIOLOGICAL MEASURES.
doc.MajorAgency: NRI-SMALL: A NOVEL POWERED LEG PROSTHESIS SIMULATO

doc.ContractDescription: MASS-RADIUS-LUMINOSITY-ROTATION RELATIONSHIPS FOR M DWARF PLANET-HOSTING STARS IN PREPARATION FOR THE TESS, GAIA AND JWST ERA M DWARF STARS DOMINATE STELLAR POPULATIONS, BUT CURRENT STELLAR EVOLUTIONARY MODELS DO NOT ACCURATELY PREDICT THEIR FUNDAMENTAL PROPERTIES AS WELL AS THEY DO FOR SUN-LIKE STARS, WITH EFFECTS FROM RAPID ROTATION BEING A PROMINENT THEORY FOR THE DISCREPANCIES. THE DISCREPANCIES NEED TO BE RESOLVED SOON: BASED ON STATISTICS FROM NASA'S KEPLER MISSION, NASA'S FUTURE TESS MISSION WILL DISCOVER HUNDREDS IF NOT THOUSANDS OF TRANSITING TERRESTRIAL EXOPLANETS ORBITING NEARBY M DWARFS. ESA'S GAIA MISSION WILL PROVIDE PARALLAXES AND CORRESPONDING ABSOLUTE MAGNITUDES FOR THE TESS M DWARF TARGETS. IT IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT TO DEVELOP ACCURATE AND PRECISE MASSRADIUS - LUMINOSITY - ROTATION RELATIONSHIPS FOR M DWARFS IN PREPARATION FOR TESS AND GAIA, SINCE ACCURATE RELATIONSHIPS ARE REQUIRED TO DETERMINE THE RADII AND EQUILIBRIUM TEMPERATURES OF TESS'S EXOPLANET DISCOVERIES TO HIGH PRECISION. IN THE FUTURE, NASA'S JWST MISSION WILL BE ABLE TO MEASURE THE ATMOSPHERIC CONSTITUENTS OF TERRESTRIAL PLANETS THAT TRANSIT M DWARFS, BUT AT A SIGNIFICANT COST IN TELESCOPE TIME. THEREFORE, THE JWST TARGETS MUST BE CHOSEN CAREFULLY FROM TESS'S DISCOVERIES, AND THEY REQUIRE THE BEST POSSIBLE KNOWLEDGE OF THE EXOPLANETS' RADII AND EQUILIBRIUM TEMPERATURES, WHICH IN TURN REQUIRES THE BEST POSSIBLE KNOWLEDGE OF THEIR M DWARF HOST STARS. WE PROPOSE TO CONDUCT A THREE-YEAR, MULTI-TELESCOPE OBSERVING CAMPAIGN TO MEASURE MASSES, RADII, DISTANCES, AND INDIVIDUAL INFRARED MAGNITUDES OF 40 NEW M DWARF ECLIPSING BINARIES DISCOVERED BY THE INVESTIGATORS IN ARCHIVAL KEPLER DATA. THE CATALOG NEARLY TRIPLES THE NUMBER OF M DWARF ECLIPSING BINARIES KNOWN TO DATE. BY COMBINING ULTRA-PRECISE PUBLICLY-AVAILABLE ARCHIVAL KEPLER PHOTOMETRY, DOUBLE-LINED SPECTROSCOPIC RADIAL VELOCITY MEASUREMENTS, ADAPTIVE OPTICS IMAGING, PARALLAX OBSERVATIONS, AND INFRARED ECLIPSE OBSERVATIONS, WE WILL MEASURE THE MASSES, RADII, DISTANCES AND INDIVIDUAL ABSOLUTE INFRARED MAGNITUDES FOR THE INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS OF THE M-DWARF BINARY STARS WITH UNPRECEDENTED ACCURACY AND PRECISION. THE INVESTIGATORS WILL USE THE MEASUREMENTS TO CREATE NEW, EMPIRICAL MASS-RADIUS-LUMINOSITY-ROTATION RELATIONSHIPS FOR M DWARFS. THESE RELATIONSHIPS WILL SETTLE LONG-STANDING CONTROVERSIES OVER THE ROLE OF ROTATION AND MAGNETIC ACTIVITY ON M DWARF PROPERTIES. THE RELATIONSHIPS WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE THE RADII AND EQUILIBRIUM TEMPERATURES OF NEARBY TERRESTRIAL EXOPLANETS THAT TRANSIT M DWARFS AS DISCOVERED BY NASA'S TRANSITING EXOPLANET SURVEY SATELLITE (TESS) MISSION, AND TO CHOSE THOSE TARGETS TO STUDY IN DETAIL WITH JWST.
SOLID WASTE REMOVAL IGF::OT::IGF

THE LOCAL INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM (LISM) IS DOMINATED BY THE LARGE, VERY LOW DENSITY CAVITY THAT SURROUNDS OUR LOCATION KNOWN AS THE LOCAL BUBBLE. INSIDE THE BUBBLE ARE SEVERAL LOW DENSITY CLOUDS INCLUDING THE ONE THAT SURROUNDS THE SOLAR SYSTEM KNOWN AS THE LOCAL INTERSTELLAR CLOUD (LIC). DIRECT EVIDENCE FROM THE OBSERVED DIFFUSE SOFT X-RAY BACKGROUND AND INDIRECT EVIDENCE FROM THE DYNAMICS OF THE THE NEARBY CLOUDS INDICATES THAT THE LOCAL BUBBLE IS FILLED WITH HOT GAS. WE PROPOSE TO INVESTIGATE THE ORIGINS AND EVOLUTION OF THE LOCAL BUBBLE AS CREATED BY ONE OR MORE SUPERNOVA EXPLOSIONS. IN ADDITION WE WILL INVESTIGATE HOW THE LIC HAS BEEN ABLE TO SURVIVE THE SHOCK THAT CREATED THE HOT GAS IN THE LOCAL BUBBLE AND ITS EVOLUTION TO ITS CURRENT STATE AS A WARM, PARTIALLY IONIZED CLOUD. WE WILL USE STATE-OF-THE-ART NUMERICAL MAGNETO-HYDRODYNAMICAL CODES COUPLED WITH THE APEC PLASMA EMISSION CODE AND DUST DESTRUCTION CALCULATIONS TO CALCULATE THE EVOLUTION OF THE BUBBLE AND THE LIC. OUR STUDIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE LARGE ARRAY OF DATA AVAILABLE ON BOTH THE LOCAL BUBBLE AND THE LIC, INCLUDING IN SITU DATA OBTAINED BY SPACECRAFT THAT HAVE DETECTED INTERSTELLAR MATTER FLOWING INTO THE HELIOSPHERE. THIS WORK WILL BE THE FIRST MODELING OF THE LISM TO INCLUDE INFORMATION FROM RECENT OBSERVATIONS AND MODELS THAT TIGHTLY CONSTRAIN THE NATURE OF THE LOCAL BUBBLE AND THE LIC AND WILL HAVE IMPLICATIONS FOR SUPERNOVA REMNANT EVOLUTION AND SHOCK-CLOUD INTERACTION WELL BEYOND THE LISM.

doc.ContractDescription: PROCURE (2) M3C4G PRIMARY 4-SLOT CHASSIS UNITS, (6) M3C4G RACK MOUNT KIT FOR THE PRIMARY 4-SLOT CHASSIS UNITS, (6) M3C4G POWER/BATTERY CONTROL MODULE WITH GIGABIT SWITCH AND TFOCA CONNECTORS, (2) DUAL DIPLEXER PREAMPLIFIER BYPASSS, (2) M3C4G ROUTER MODULE 3 WITH CISCO 5915 ESS2020, (14) M3C4G (RIGHT ANGLE) TO KG-250X (STRAIGHT) POWER CABLE, 96IN, AND (4) V1 LATITUDE 14 RUGGED EXTREME LAPTOPS
N103C4/TURNER ADDED FY17 REIMBURSABLE FUNDING FOR LAYBERTH SERVICES FOR USNS BENAVIDEZ AND USNS MENDONCA

CLIMATE CHANGE IS RAPIDLY IMPACTING NUMEROUS ECOSYSTEMS. CLIMATE-RELATED IMPACTS ON FOUNDATION SPECIES, DOMINANT SPECIES THAT PROVIDE FOOD AND HABITAT, ARE PARTICULARLY CONSEQUENTIAL. GIANT KELP, MACROCYSTIS PYRIFERA, IS A GLOBALLY DISTRIBUTED FOUNDATION SPECIES THAT SUPPORTS SOME OF THE MOST PRODUCTIVE COASTAL ECOSYSTEMS IN THE WORLD. HOWEVER, GIANT KELP IS SENSITIVE TO CHANGES IN ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS; WE DO NOT KNOW HOW ITS GLOBAL DISTRIBUTION AND ABUNDANCE HAS CHANGED IN THE MODERN ERA. CHARACTERIZING CHANGE IN KELPS AT EVEN REGIONAL SCALES IS IMPRACTICAL VIA FIELD SAMPLING. LUCKILY, INCREASES IN THE AVAILABILITY OF LONG TERM GLOBAL SATELLITE IMAGERY HAS MADE IT POSSIBLE TO OBSERVE KELP FORESTS AT LARGE SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL SCALES VIA LANDSAT. HOWEVER, THE PROCESS OF CREATING MAPS OF KELP CANOPY FROM SATELLITE IMAGERY HAS DEFIED AUTOMATION, REQUIRING TIME-CONSUMING MANUAL ANALYSIS. HERE WE PROPOSE TO EXPAND THE GEOGRAPHIC SCOPE OF A CITIZEN SCIENCE PLATFORM USING LANDSAT DATA (HTTP://FLOATINGFORESTS.ORG) TO EXAMINE CHANGE IN GIANT KELP ABUNDANCE OVER TIME AND ASK FUNDAMENTAL QUESTIONS ABOUT CLIMATE IMPACTS ON GLOBAL KELP PRODUCTIVITY. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A GENERALIZED TOOL IN COLLABORATION WITH ZOONIVERSE TO BUILD ONLINE CITIZEN SCIENCE PROJECTS USING LANDSAT IMAGERY. PROTOTYPE PHASE: THUS FAR, WE HAVE COLLABORATED WITH THE ONLINE CITIZEN SCIENCE ORGANIZATION ZOONIVERSE TO BUILD A PLATFORM, FLOATING FORESTS, TO HARNESS THE POWER OF CITIZEN SCIENCE TO MAP THE WORLDS GIANT KELP FORESTS OVER 30 YEARS (HTTP://FLOATINGFORESTS.ORG). WE HAVE AMASSED AN INITIAL DATASET OF OVER 2 MILLION CLASSIFICATIONS TO VALIDATE CITIZEN SCIENCE CLASSIFICATIONS OF KELP. WE ARE NOW READY TO MOVE FROM SMALL REGIONAL DATASETS TO MAP THE PLANET ALONGSIDE OUR CITIZEN SCIENTISTS AND ANSWER FUNDAMENTAL QUESTIONS ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF GLOBAL CHANGE ON GIANT KELP AT AN UNPRECEDENTED SCALE. GIVEN THESE EFFORTS, WE HAVE ESTABLISHED OUR NEXT SET OF GOALS TO MOVE THE PROJECT FORWARD. 1) FINALIZE A DATA PIPELINE CONVERTING USER-GENERATED DATA INTO GEOSPATIAL DATA READY FOR ANALYSIS. 2) FINALIZE CALIBRATION AND VALIDATION OF USER CLASSIFICATIONS WITH PREEXISTING EXPERT CLASSIFICATIONS. 3) USE THE PROCESS OF IMPORTING REMAINING LANDSAT DATA FOR THE REST OF THE PLANET TO CREATE A GENERALIZED LANDSAT-ZOONIVERSE DATA PIPELINE. 4) FINALIZE A DATA-SHARING FRAMEWORK SO THAT CITIZEN SCIENTISTS CAN ACCESS ITH FLOATING FORESTS DATA. 5) BEGIN CRAFTING AN EDUCATION AND OUTREACH STRATEGY TO BROADEN OUR REACH. IMPLEMENTATION PHASE: DURING IMPLEMENTATION, WE WILL ADDRESS OUR SCIENTIFIC GOALS BY USING DATA TO MODEL THE LONG-TERM CHANGES IN GIANT KELP. WE WILL MERGE OUR KELP DATA WITH VARIABLES SUCH AS WATER TEMPERATURE (FROM MODIS DATA), NUTRIENTS (DERIVED FROM SEA SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN CERTAIN REGIONS), PHOTOSYNTHETICALLY AVAILABLE RADIATION (FROM MODIS OCEAN COLOR DATA), WAVE DISTURBANCE (FROM WAVE WATCH III) AND HUMAN IMPACT VARIABLES TO MODEL THE IMPACT OF HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL DRIVERS ON GIANT KELP FORESTS. WE WILL USE LESSONS LEARNED FROM OUR DATA IMPORT PROCESS TO AID ZOONIVERSES EFFORTS TO EXPAND THE FUNCTIONALITY OF THEIR PROJECT BUILDER TO SUPPORT THE BROADER RESEARCH COMMUNITY IN CREATING CITIZEN SCIENCE PROJECTS BASED ON NASA SATELLITE DATA. THE ZOONIVERSE TEAM WILL HOST IN-PERSON AND ONLINE TRAINING WORKSHOPS FOR RESEARCHERS IN USING THE PROJECT BUILDER TO BUILD THEIR OWN LANDSAT-BASED CROWD-SOURCED RESEARCH PROJECTS, INCORPORATE THE RESULTS INTO THEIR RESEARCH, AND SUSTAIN AND NURTURE THEIR ONLINE VOLUNTEER COMMUNITIES. FINALLY, TO DRAW IN MORE CITIZEN SCIENTISTS, WE WILL 1) BUILD A SERIES OF FLOATING-FORESTS INQUIRY-BASED SCIENCE CURRICULA FOR PRIMARY,SECONDARY, UNIVERSITY, AND MUSEUM CLASSROOMS AND 2) FURTHER OUR EFFORTS IN ONLINE OUTREACH, HOSTING ONLINE SEMINARS ON KELP RESEARCH AND OPEN DATA HACKATHONS WHERE WE WILL TEACH CITIZEN SCIENTISTS HOW TO USE OUR DATA.

doc.ContractDescription: REPAIR OF (2) MCM SHAFTS
REPAIR OF (2) MCM SHAFTS

HARPS-N IS AN ULTRA-STABLE FIBER-FED HIGH-RESOLUTION SPECTROGRAPH OPTIMIZED FOR THE MEASUREMENT OF VERY PRECISE RADIAL VELOCITIES, AND A PRIMARY MOTIVATION FOR ITS CONSTRUCTION WAS THE PURSUIT OF KEPLER PLANETS. WE HAVE 40 NIGHTS OF GUARANTEED TIME PER YEAR DEDICATED TO THE STUDY OF SMALL KEPLER PLANETS. THE INSTRUMENT IS ALREADY DELIVERING A VELOCITY PRECISION SUFFICIENT TO MEASURE THE MASSES OF CLOSE- IN PLANETS WITH RADII FROM 1 3 EARTH RADII, AND OUR TEAM RECENTLY PUBLISHED THE FIRST MASS MEASUREMENT OF AN EARTH-SIZED EXOPLANET. WE PROPOSE TO DETERMINE THE MASSES FOR AT LEAST 10 PLANETS SMALLER THAN 3 EARTH RADII TO A RELATIVE PRECISION OF 15 PERCENT, WITH THE GOAL OF OBTAINING SUCH A MEASUREMENT FOR 20 SUCH PLANETS. THESE MEASUREMENTS WILL HAVE AN ENORMOUS IMPACT ON OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THESE SO-CALLED SUPER-EARTHS AND SMALL NEPTUNES. THEY WOULD FORM THE CORE DATASET WITH WHICH THE INTERNATIONAL ASTRONOMICAL COMMUNITY CAN MEANINGFULLY SEEK TO UNDERSTAND THESE OBJECTS AND THEIR FORMATION IN A QUANTITATIVE FASHION. WE WILL PLACE LIMITS UPON THE MAXIMAL SIZE AND MASS FOR ROCKY PLANETS, WHICH HAVE ONLY A SMALL, SECONDARY ATMOSPHERE, AND THE MINIMUM SIZE AND MASS FOR NEPTUNE-LIKE PLANETS, WHICH HAVE ACCRETED AND RETAINED AN ENVELOPE OF PRIMORDIAL H/HE GAS. ALTHOUGH PRELIMINARY ATTEMPTS TO DETERMINE THE MASS-RADIUS RELATION IN THIS REGIME HAVE BEEN PUBLISHED, THESE EFFORTS ARE IMPEDED BY IMPOVERISHED DATA SETS. WE WILL PROVIDE THE ENABLING DATA SET THAT WILL ALLOW US TO ACCURATELY DESCRIBE THE MASS-RADIUS RELATION, AND TO DETERMINE IN WHICH REGIMES IT IS SINGLE VALUED AND IN WHICH REGIONS THERE EXISTS A MIXED POPULATION OF PLANETS WITH DIFFERENT BULK COMPOSITIONS. WE MAY CONSTRAIN WHETHER THIS RELATION ITSELF DEPENDS UPON OTHER PARAMETERS, NOTABLY ORBITAL PERIOD, PLANETARY MULTIPLICITY, AND STELLAR METALLICITY. THE IMPACT OF OUR RESULTS ON CURRENT AND FUTURE NASA MISSIONS WILL BE SIGNIFICANT: FIRST, WE WILL GREATLY INCREASE THE SCIENTIFIC IMPACT OF THE LEGACY DATASET FROM THE NASA KEPLER MISSION, BY DETERMINING THE MASSES FOR THE MOST INTERESTING PLANETS FOUND BY KEPLER AND BY THE ONGOING K2 MISSION. SECOND, BY DETERMINING THE TRANSITION FROM ROCKY TO NEPTUNE-LIKE PLANETS, WE WILL INFORM THE SELECTION OF TARGETS FOR THE UPCOMING TRANSITING EXOPLANET SURVEY SATELLITE (TESS) MISSION, AND OUR RESULTS WILL AID THE PRIORITIZATION OF TESS PLANETS FOR FOLLOW-UP. THIRD, WHILE WE DON T EXPECT THAT MANY KEPLER PLANETS WILL BE STUDIED BY JWST FOR ATMOSPHERIC CHARACTERIZATION, OUR MASS-RADIUS RELATIONSHIP WILL BE CENTRAL FOR THE COMMUNITY TO SELECT THE PLANETS ORBITING NEARBY STARS FOR WHICH ATMOSPHERIC STUDIES WITH JWST WILL BE THE MOST PROFITABLE.
doc.MajorAgency: : FOLLOWING THE KEPLER PLANETS WITH THE HARPS-N SP
doc.MajorFundingAgency: : FOLLOWING THE KEPLER PLANETS WITH THE HARPS-N SP

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF DEVELOPING RETRIEVAL ALGORITHMS FOR NH3 AND CO FROM NPP CRIS MEASUREMENTS. AMMONIA (NH3) AND CARBON MONOXIDE (CO) PLAY KEY ROLES IN ATMOSPHERIC CHEMISTRY: NH3 AS PART OF THE NITROGEN CYCLE AND CO AS A PRECURSOR FOR OZONE AND CARBON DIOXIDE. CONTINUING INDUSTRIALIZATION ACROSS THE GLOBE IS ALTERING THE SOURCE INTENSITY AND DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GASES BOTH DIRECTLY AND THROUGH TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE ADJUSTMENTS DUE TO CLIMATE CHANGE. IN TURN THESE SPECIES ALSO AFFECT THE CLIMATE: NH3 IS AN IMPORTANT SOURCE OF PM2.5 AEROSOLS THAT HAVE A SMALL BUT HIGHLY UNCERTAIN RADIATIVE EFFECT. CO IS ESTIMATED TO HAVE AN INDIRECT FORCING OF 0.2 W/M2. FEEDBACKS ASSOCIATED WITH CLIMATE CHANGE WILL MODULATE THE EFFECT NH3 AND CO HAVE ON ATMOSPHERIC CHEMISTRY, AIR QUALITY AND THE CLIMATE ITSELF. BOTH SPECIES ARE HIGHLY VARIABLE IN SPACE AND TIME NH3 MORE SO THAN CO AND IT IS DIFFICULT TO PREDICT FUTURE EMISSIONS BASED ON THE CURRENT DATABASES, WHICH ARE SPARSE OVER MUCH OF THE EARTH. NASA EOS INSTRUMENTS LIKE TES, MOPITT, AND AIRS HAVE PROVIDED A WEALTH OF INFORMATION ON THE DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GASES, AND SHOWN THAT CO LEVELS ARE IS DECREASING SIGNIFICANTLY. HOWEVER, THEY ARE WELL PAST THEIR DESIGN LIFE AND SO THE FUTURE OF THESE CRITICAL NASA EOS RECORDS IS ENDANGERED. THE CRIS INSTRUMENTS ON THE SUOMI NPP SATELLITE AND ON THE FUTURE JPSS PLATFORMS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO MONITOR THESE SPECIES ACROSS THE GLOBE OVER MANY YEARS ACCURATELY AND CONSISTENTLY. OUR PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THE ALGORITHMS AND SOFTWARE TO RETRIEVE NH3 AND CO BASED ON THE OPTIMAL ESTIMATION APPROACH AND CONSTRAINTS THAT WE ADOPTED FOR TES NH3 AND MOPITT CO. THIS WILL ENABLE NASA TO CREATE CONSISTENT EXTENDED NH3 AND CO DATA RECORDS THAT WILL PROVIDE MODELERS WITH THE INFORMATION NEEDED FOR A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROCESSES IN WHICH EACH ARE INVOLVED. THIS IN TURN WILL INFORM THE POLICY DECISIONS THAT ULTIMATELY AFFECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE HEALTH OF OUR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT.
doc.ProductorServiceCode: AR22: R&D- SPACE: SCIENCE/APPLICATIONS (APPLIED RESEARCH/EXPLORATORY DEVELOPMENT)

doc.ContractDescription: SOLAR CORONAL JETS ARE ARCHETYPAL EXAMPLES OF RECONNECTION IN ASTROPHYSICAL PLASMAS. THEIR FREQUENCY, SIMPLE TOPOLOGY SIZE AND DURATION MAKE THEM IDEAL TARGETS FOR DETAILED MULTI-WAVELENGTH, MULTI-INSTRUMENT ANALYSIS. THE INTERFACE REGION IMAGING SPECTROGRAPH IRIS HAS THE SPATIAL RESOLUTION AND SPECTRAL COVERAGE TO OBSERVE JET PLASMA SURROUNDING THE RECONNECTION REGION IN UNPRECEDENTED DETAIL. THE IRIS SPATIAL RESOLUTION (0.) IS CRITICAL FOR THESE INVESTIGATIONS. USING THE SIMULTANEOUS SLIT-JAW IMAGES AND TRANSITION REGION LINE SPECTRA (E.G. SI IV, O IV) WE WILL FOLLOW THE EVOLUTION OF THE JET AND IDENTIFY THE PLASMA DYNAMICS AROUND THE SPECTRAL LOCATION WHILE OBTAINING VELOCITY, DENSITY AND NON-THERMAL LINE WIDTHS ALONG THE SLIT. HINODE AND SDO OBSERVATIONS GIVE IMPORTANT CONTEXT: PHOTOSPHERIC MAGNETIC FIELD STRUCTURE AND EVOLUTION, CORONAL PLASMA DYNAMICS AND ENERGETICS. INITIALLY, WE WILL USE EXISTING OBSERVATIONS OF SEVEN CORONAL JETS SEEN BY IRIS, HINODE AND SDO TO ADDRESS THREE CRITICAL GOALS: IDENTIFY THE STRUCTURE AND DYNAMICS OF THE ACCELERATION REGION IN CORONAL JETS. BUILD AND EVOLVE DATA-CONSTRAINED 3D MAGNETIC MODELS OF THE RECONNECTION REGION USING PHOTOSPHERIC MAGNETIC FIELDS, CHROMOSPHERIC AND CORONAL OBSERVATIONS IN ORDER TO INTERPRET THE PLASMA INFORMATION. IDENTIFY THE MECHANISM FOR SUPPLYING PLASMA TO AND ACCELERATING THE JET. ADDRESSING THE COMPLEX PROBLEMS OUTLINED ABOVE REQUIRES OBSERVATIONS FROM MULTIPLE SPACE- CRAFT AND STATEOFTHEART MODELING TOOLS. OUR APPROACH IS TO USE: DETAILED IRIS ANALYSIS OF NON-THERMAL WIDTH, DOPPLER VELOCITY AND ASYMMETRY, DENSITY, AND TEMPERATURE MAPS JOINT ANALY SIS OF HINODE/XRT AND EIS, AND SDO/AIA AND HMI OBSERVATIONS; 3D DATA-CONSTRAINED MAGNETIC FIELD MODELING USING STATIC POTENTIAL AND NON-LINEAR FORCE-FREE FIELD MODELS; MAGNETOFRICTIONAL AND MHD SIMULATIONS. ALL OF THE DIAGNOSTIC MODELING TOOLS EXIST AND HAVE BEEN TESTED, SO NO CODE DEVELOPMENT IS REQUIRED. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS RELEVANT TO THE INSTRUMENT GOAL OF INVESTIGATING THE TRANSPORT OF ENERGY AND MATTER FROM THE CHROMOSPHERE AND TRANSITION REGION TO THE CORONA.

WE PROPOSE TO 1) COMPILE A HYPERSPECTRAL RRS-IOPS DATASET FROM FIELD MEASUREMENTS; 2) IMPROVE THE ESTIMATION OF SSIOP FROM OCEAN COLOR; 3) REVISE THE QAA AND HOPE (A HYPERSPECTRAL OPTIMIZATION ALGORITHM) TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE HYPERSPECTRAL AND UV MEASUREMENTS OFFERED BY PACE, WITH A GOAL TO EXPAND THE CURRENT IOP PRODUCTS TO INCLUDE INFORMATION BEYOND CHLOROPHYLL-A (E.G., THE ABSORPTION COEFFICIENTS OF CHLOROPHYLL-B,-C, AND PHYCOCYANIN); AND 4) TEST AND EVALUATE THESE SEMIANALYTICAL ALGORITHMS WITH HICO MEASUREMENTS. OUTCOMES FROM THIS EFFORT WILL BE FOURFOLD: 1) A HYPERSPECTRAL RRS-IOPS DATASET WITH CLOSURE FOR THE COMMUNITY TO USE, 2) IMPROVED ESTIMATION OF SSIOP FROM OCEAN COLOR TO BENEFIT ALL SEMI-ANALYTICAL ALGORITHMS, 3) REVISED QAA AND HOPE TO DERIVE HYPERSPECTRAL IOP PRODUCTS, AND 4) EXPERIENCE WITH HICO IN PROCESSING AND STORING HYPERSPECTRAL IMAGE PRODUCTS. THESE RESULTS WILL PROVIDE DESIRED TOOLS AND KNOWLEDGE FOR PROCESSING HYPERSPECTRAL MEASUREMENTS BY PACE, AND CONTRIBUTE TO "CONSENSUS AND COMMUNITYENDORSED PATHS FORWARD FOR THE PACE SENSOR(S)".

doc.ContractDescription: PLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS OF THE GLOBAL OCEAN PROFOUNDLY AFFECT CLIMATE AND LIFE ON EARTH. NASAS OCEAN COLOR SATELLITE RECORD TELLS US THAT THESE INVALUABLE ECOSYSTEMS ARE HIGHLY RESPONSIVE TO CLIMATE VARIABILITY, WITH CHANGES IN OCEAN PRODUCTION IMPACTING FOOD PRODUCTION, UPTAKE OF ATMOSPHERIC CO2, AND EMISSION OF CLIMATE-REGULATING AEROSOLS. INTERGOVERNMENTAL PANEL ON CLIMATE CHANGE CLIMATE SIMULATIONS SUGGEST THAT SURFACE OCEAN TEMPERATURES WILL WARM BY +1.3 TO +2.8 C GLOBALLY OVER THE 21ST CENTURY, WITH MAJOR CONSEQUENCES ON PHYSICAL PROPERTIES OF THE SURFACE OCEAN WHERE PLANKTON POPULATIONS THRIVE. THE PRESSING QUESTION IS, HOW WILL THESE CHANGES ALTER PLANKTON PRODUCTION, SPECIES COMPOSITION, AND AEROSOL EMISSIONS TODAY, EVEN THE SIGN OF THESE POTENTIAL NAAMES COMBINES SHIP, AIRCRAFT, SATELLITE, AUTONOMOUS SENSOR, AND MODELING DATA TO ADDRESS KNOWLEDGE GAPS ON OCEAN PLANKTON AND THEIR BIOGENIC AEROSOL EMISSIONS. CHANGES REMAINS UNRESOLVED. OUR ABILITY TO PREDICT EARTH SYSTEM CONSEQUENCES OF A WARMING OCEAN AND DEVELOP REALISTIC MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION STRATEGIES DEPENDS ON RESOLVING CONFLICTING HYPOTHESES REGARDING FACTORS CONTROLLING PLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS AND BIOGENIC AEROSOL EMISSIONS.
doc.MajorAgency: THE NORTH ATLANTIC AEROSOL AND MARINE ECOSYSTEMS S
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE NORTH ATLANTIC AEROSOL AND MARINE ECOSYSTEMS S

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE TWO RELATED PROJECTS TO EXPLORE DUST TRANSPORT AND EVOLUTION IN THE INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM (ISM) IN GALAXIES ON BOTH SMALL SCALES AND LARGE SCALES. FIRST, WE WILL IMPROVE THE MODELING OF THE ESCAPE OF SUPERNOVA-CREATED DUST GRAINS FROM THEIR NATAL EJECTA CLUMPS AND OUT OF THE HOT INTERIOR OF THE SUPERNOVA REMNANT. THAT PROJECT WILL AIM TO DETERMINE HOW MUCH DUST CAN BE INJECTED INTO THE ISM BY PRIMORDIAL AND MODERN SUPERNOVAE. SECOND, WE WILL MODEL THE SUBSEQUENT TRANSPORT AND PROCESSING OF DUST GRAINS FROM THEIR BIRTHPLACES IN SUPERNOVAE OR ASYMPTOTIC GIANT BRANCH STARS UNTIL THEY ARE DESTROYED. THAT PROJECT WILL HAVE AS ITS GOAL UNDERSTANDING HOW THE OBSERVED SIZE DISTRIBUTION, ABUNDANCE, AND LIFETIME OF GRAINS ARE DETERMINED BY PROCESSES OCCURRING THROUGHOUT THE ISM, MOVING BEYOND GLOBAL AVERAGING TO EXAMINE THE RANGE OF OUTCOMES THAT OCCUR FOR INDIVIDUAL GRAINS. AS PART OF THE SECOND PROJECT WE WILL EXAMINE WHETHER GRAIN PROCESSING YIELDS DIFFERENT DEPLETION LEVELS IN MILKY WAY-TYPE GALAXIES, COMPARED TO LOW-METALLICITY, DWARF GALAXIES. THESE PROJECTS WILL INVOLVE THE USE PRE-EXISTING NUMERICAL HYDRODYNAMICAL CODES IN CONCERT WITH OUR DUST PROCESSING CODES. THE RESULTS OF OUR WORK WILL AID IN UNDERSTANDING A WIDE RANGE OF OBSERVATIONS CARRIED OUT BY NASA MISSIONS RANGING FROM INFRARED EMISSION GENERATED BY HEATED DUST TO ELEMENTAL DEPLETION PATTERNS DEDUCED VIA UV OBSERVATIONS AND X-RAY EMISSION FROM SUPERNOVA REMNANTS. DUST PLAYS A CRITICAL ROLE GALAXY EVOLUTION AND SO OUR RESULTS WILL ALSO AID IN A BROAD RANGE OF INVESTIGATIONS RELATED TO STAR FORMATION AND METALLICITY EVOLUTION FROM GALAXIES IN THE EARLY UNIVERSE UP UNTIL THE CURRENT EPOCH.
doc.MajorAgency: THE INJECTION, TRANSPORT AND EVOLUTION OF DUST IN
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE INJECTION, TRANSPORT AND EVOLUTION OF DUST IN

doc.ContractDescription: THIS PROJECT WILL BE DEVOTED TO THE CONTINUING DEVELOPMENT OF THE MOLECULAR SPECTROSCOPIC LINE LISTS THAT WILL AID CURRENT AND FUTURE STUDIES OF PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES. SPECTROSCOPIC PARAMETERS FOR STUDIES OF THE TERRESTRIAL ATMOSPHERE HAVE BEEN COMPILED FOR MANY YEARS IN THE HITRAN DATABASE WHICH IS BEING MAINTAINED AND CONSTANTLY UPDATED AT THE HARVARD SMITHSONIAN CENTER FOR ASTROPHYSICS.THE HITRAN DATABASE IS CONSIDERED A US NATIONAL TREASURE AND IS ONE OF THE MOST CITED REFERENCES IN THE GEOSCIENCES. WHILE THIS DATABASE HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY USED BY DIFFERENT REMOTE-SENSING MISSIONS OF THE TERRESTRIAL ATMOSPHERE, THE EXTENT OF PARAMETERS CONTAINED IN HITRAN IS LACKING COMPLETION IN A MAJORITY OF CASES TO STUDY PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES. THE FUNDING FROM THE NASA AURA PROGRAM DOES NOT IMPLY SUPPORT OF ASTROPHYSICALLY IMPORTANT PARAMETERS, INCLUDING PARAMETERS FOR THE SPECIES THAT ARE NOT PRESENT IN THE EARTH ATMOSPHERE IN DETECTABLE AMOUNTS. NEVERTHELESS, HIGH RESOLUTION SPECTROSCOPIC PARAMETERS ARE EXTREMELY IMPORTANT WHEN INTERPRETING PLANETARY SPECTRA RECORDED WITH SPECTROMETERS LOCATED ON THE GROUND AND, MORE IMPORTANTLY, ON BOARD NUMEROUS CURRENT AND FUTURE SPACE MISSIONS INCLUDING SPITZER, HUBBLE, CASSINI, VENUS EXPRESS, JAMES WEBB SPACE TELESCOPE AND MANY OTHERS. CCURATE REFERENCE DATA ARE REQUIRED FOR DETERMINATION OF ATMOSPHERIC STRUCTURE AND COMPOSITION,INCLUDING THOSE OF EXTRASOLAR PLANETS, SEARCHES FOR TRACE CONSTITUENTS REPRESENTATIVE OF COMPLEX INTERACTIONS BETWEEN THE PLANETARY SURFACE AND THE ATMOSPHERE, THE INTERIOR OF THE DEEP AND UPPER ATMOSPHERE, AND SEASONAL ACTIVITY. AT THE PRESENT TIME, THE ASTROPHYSICS COMMUNITY HAS HAD TO RELY ON THE SCATTERED INFORMATION IN THE LITERATURE WHICH IS AVAILABLE IN A GREAT VARIETY OF UNITS, FORMALISMS AND FORMATS WHILE SOME COVER ONLY VERY LIMITED SPECTRAL RANGES. IN ADDITION, THESE DATA DO NOT HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF HAVING GONE THROUGH A VALIDATION AND FILTERING PROCESS SUCH AS EXISTS FOR HITRAN.

doc.ContractDescription: 4536424217!BULK ROAD SALT SODIUM CHLORIDE PER TON

THE PI DR. LI MOVED FROM THE ORIGINAL INSTITUTION (UCLA) TO THE NEW INSTITUTION (BOSTON UNIVERSITY) IN SEPTEMBER 2016. THEREFORE, THE REMAINING TASKS OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PRIMARILY BE PERFORMED AT BOSTON UNIVERSITY BY COLLABORATING WITH TWO ORIGINAL CO-IS, WHO WILL STAY AT UCLA. IN THIS PROPOSED PROJECT, WE AIM TO ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING IMPORTANT SCIENCE QUESTIONS, WHICH ARE DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO THE PRINCIPAL GOALS OF THE HELIOPHYSICS GUEST INVESTIGATOR (H-GI) PROGRAM, AS WELL AS NASAS VAN ALLEN PROBES MISSION. THESE SCIENCE QUESTIONS ARE: 1) WHAT IS THE GLOBAL EVOLUTION OF CHORUS WAVES AND WHAT ARE THEIR QUANTITATIVE ROLES IN ENERGETIC ELECTRON ACCELERATION AND LOSS PROCESSES DURING VARIOUS LEVELS OF GEOMAGNETICACTIVITY? 2) WHAT IS THE GLOBAL EVOLUTION OF HISS WAVES AND WHAT ARE THEIR QUANTITATIVE CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE ENERGETIC ELECTRON LOSS PROCESS? 3) DOES THE GLOBAL WAVE DISTRIBUTION OBTAINED FROM STATISTICAL WAVE DATA ACCURATELY REPRESENT THE ACTUAL INSTANTANEOUS WAVE EVOLUTION OF CHORUS AND HISS ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS?
